intro: Saurauia pseudopittieri f. veranii, commonly known as the Vanuatu flame tree, is a rare and striking plant native to the island of Vanuatu. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant red and orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its foliage consists of opposite, ovate leaves that are usually dark green and glossy. Due to its limited distribution and unique floral display, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
